description: Family 1 "Rule 90 x Rule 150 Array" read by antidiagonals.
comments: Infinitely many one-dimensional cellular automaton rules (given in sequence A048705) occur in this array, as combinations of CA-rules "90" (generates rows) and "150" (generates columns).No pattern occurs twice in such arrays.Each row/column can be generated from its predecessor row/column with SHIFTXORADJ transformation, given in A048711.
links: Index entries for sequences related to cellular automata
maple: trinv := n -> floor((1+sqrt(1+8*n))/2); # Gives integral inverses of the triangular numbers
author: Antti Karttunen, Mar 18 1999
